intro: Licania piresii, commonly known as the Pires' licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Licania piresii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
